page.title: 15A local resident
page.content: Brenda Rhodes has lived in Chinnor for 16 years.The village is a fast growing, dormitory and Mrs Rhodes feels that it has lost much of it's community spirit. She shops in Chinnor and High Wycombe, particularly from the hyper-market, ASDA. Her favourite shop is Ells and Farrier,which she says is very old fashioned and sells a fascinating range of theatrical beads and sequins. In her spare time Mrs Rhodes does quilling, makes small toys,reads,cooks and is a member of the Women's Institute. Her hobbies are collecting greetings cards(1850-1950), collecting china made and painted by E. Radford, collecting eggcups,embroidery and knitting. She feels that Chinnor would be improved by a community centre including a swimming pool.A by-pass is also needed to stop heavy lorries using the village to get to the M40.
